title: Context-Based Algebra Instructional Design for K-12: Support Strategies for Students with Intellectual and Developmental Disabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Basic arithmetic skills, core principles of special education, and foundational curriculum design knowledge
context.additional_context: Focuses on preservice teachers acquiring concrete pedagogical methods applicable in real educational settings. Establishes a visual-aid learning environment utilizing digital devices (tablets/interactive whiteboards).

learning_goals: Learners can design instructional materials explaining algebraic concepts (variables, equations, graphs) using real-life contexts (e.g., allowance management, simple budget calculations).
Learners can present three or more step-by-step math problem-solving strategies tailored to the cognitive levels of students with intellectual/developmental disabilities.
Learners can develop a context-based algebra lesson model using digital tools (calculation apps, visual modeling software) and evaluate its feasibility.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
